chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child
Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Allen Huber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Allen Huber is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Allen Huber was found guilty of 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • Allen Huber was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).
  • Allen Huber was found guilty of Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Allen  Huber in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Defendant Allen  Huber in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 11:11 am. Pre- sentence filed.  Court has reviewed Pre-sentence. State has no corrections.  Atty Casey has no corrections.  State gives sentencing argument, ct 2 withheld sentence 2 years probation, ct's 4 & 5 withheld sentence 3 years probation, concurrent to each other, 1 year jail only one ct. Credit given only if revoked, no contact with S.M.J., dob 1-8-1997, costs, Sex offender evaluation & treatment, Sex Offender Register, DNA sample surcharge. Victim rights complied. Atty Casey gives sentencing argument. 142 days credit. Agrees with 3 year probation, 5 months jail, given credit. Def. has nothing to say. Court gives statement & orders 
Ct 2 6 months jail, 142 days credit, costs, DNA sample & 200 surcharge
Ct's 4  withheld prison sentence  3 years probation, 6 months jail, no credit, consecutive to Ct 2, costs, DNA surcharge of 250, no contact with S.M.J,  No unauthorized contact with anyone under age of 18 
Sex offender evaluation & treatment recommend
Sex offender Registration for 15 years
ct 5 Court orders same sentence from ct 4 withheld prison sentence 3 years probation  6 months jail, consecutive to ct 2 & concurrent to ct 4,  no credit, Huber privileges, Sentence Commence immediately
Def. advised of firearm & voting rights.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Def. advised of postconviction rights. State questions Review on Defer Entry of Judgment, Review set for 1-21-19 @ 1 pm.  Ct 3 will be dismissed if complies. DNA Sample on all ct's. Def. given pp. on ct 2, 1st payment due in Aug.

Defendant Allen  Huber in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Defendant Allen  Huber in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 1:45 pm  Statement by DA.  Def to enter plea.  State will move to dismiss Ct 1.  Def to enter plea to 2,3,4,5.  Ct  3 Judgment to be deferred for 3 yrs.  Ct 2,4, &5 State requesting PSI, free to argue.    Atty Casey agrees.  Def agrees.  Plea questionnaire form completed, reviewed by court.  Statement by Atty Casey in regards to plea questionnaire.  Correction on plea questionnaire by court.  Ct 2 - No contest plea  Ct 3 - No contest plea.  Ct 4 & 5 - No contest plea to both counts.  Constitutional rights, right to jury trial and elements reviewed.    Penalties reviewed.  Statement by Atty Casey.  Court finds pleas entered freely & voluntarily.  Court finds def understands charges, penalties and rights.  Factual basis.  Court will accept pleas.  Ct 1 - Dismissed by court.  Ct 3 Judgment deferred, plea accepted, found guilty. Deferred for 3 yrs or upon completion of sentence which ever is greater.  Judgment will be deferred upon sentencing. If complies with deferred agreement, ct 3 will be dismissed  Found guilty Ct 2, 4 & 5.  Presentence report to be completed.  Report to be completed by Jan 13, 2016

State Exh #1 - Statement from S.J.
State Exh #2 - Statement from A.H.

Defendant Allen Huber in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Defendant Allen Huber in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls  @ 2:08 pm.  Competency hearing, Report from Dr. Galli which finds def. competent, State has received report, Atty Casey has received report.  State has no more additional evidence, Defense does not have no more additional evidence.  Def. has talked to Atty.  Legally competent.  Court finds def. competent & will proceed with case, if not competent than will suspend hearing.  Def. understands.  Atty Casey questions def. regarding report.  Court finds defendant legally competent.  Def. does not object with proceeding with case.  Court finds def. legally competent 971.13, 971.14.  Court will proceed with preliminary hearing.  Invg. Daniel Bauknecht, duly sworn on oath, testifies.  State Exh #1 Statement from S.J. Dated 8-30-15, State Exh #1 offered & received.  State Exh #2 Statement from A.H. 8-30-15. State Exh #2 offered & received. State rest.  Court finds probable cause & binds over.  Exhibits #1 & 2 sealed by Court. Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Allen Huber in court with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Defendant Allen Huber in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:15 a.m. Motion to modify bond. Atty Casey gives arguments for reducing cash bond. Response by the State. Remarks by the Court. Court will not change bond today, however, reserves right to renew motion at later date. Statement by Atty Casey, requests competency evaluation. Court will order competency evaluation. Off the record for scheduling @ 9:44. Back on the record @ 9:46. Court will prepare order.  Competency hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
